column4: i made two partitions on my box and installed ubuntu on the second one, windows XP on the first, how do i get the dual boot option every time i start up??
edit /etc/grub/ment.lst
comment out hiddenmenu
i cant even get to ubuntu, windows XP boots first, i looked in setup but didnt see anything about partitions
is ubuntu on a seperate hdd?
Gamma: still with me?  no, ubuntu and windows XP is on the same hd
the problem is that only windows boots, i want to be able to choose which one
where did you install the ubuntu bootloader(grub)?
where the first partition is
wherever that is
it should be installed on the MBR. that's what your bios loads
when i get to the MBR, i should have to choice which OS to boot from?
yes *if* you install the boot loader on the MBR, otherwise windows's bootloader is still there doing what it always did
Gamma: well i installed ubuntu first, then XP second, so would the XP bootload overwrite GRUB??
hmm so i guess i have to reinstall ubuntu...will GRUB overwrite the XP bootload?
see this http://people.ubuntulinux.org/~mako/ubuntu-traffic/u20041203_15.html#4
Gamma: thank you very much, one last q: is my ubuntu root device a /?
that depends on where it is on the ide cable, and which interface it's on
how would i determine that?
/dev/hda is primary master, hdb pri. slave, hdc secondary master, hdd sec. slave
Gamma: alright mine would be hda then.... thanks a whole lot
you also need the partiton number...
/dev/hda1 would be the first partition
